fields.description: The list of aggregation types (comma separated) to retrieve.
fields.name: Aggregation

fields.description: When set to true, if the timespan passed in is not supported by this metric, the API will return the result using the closest supported timespan. When set to false, an error is returned for invalid timespan parameters. Defaults to false.
fields.name: AutoAdjustTimegrain

fields.description:
The **$filter** is used to reduce the set of metric data returned.
Example:
Metric contains metadata A, B and C.
- Return all time series of C where A = a1 and B = b1 or b2
**$filter=A eq ‘a1’ and B eq ‘b1’ or B eq ‘b2’ and C eq ‘*’**
- Invalid variant:
**$filter=A eq ‘a1’ and B eq ‘b1’ and C eq ‘*’ or B = ‘b2’**
This is invalid because the logical or operator cannot separate two different metadata names.
- Return all time series where A = a1, B = b1 and C = c1:
**$filter=A eq ‘a1’ and B eq ‘b1’ and C eq ‘c1’**
- Return all time series where A = a1
**$filter=A eq ‘a1’ and B eq ‘*’ and C eq ‘*’**.
fields.name: Filter

fields.description:
The interval (i.e. timegrain) of the query in ISO 8601 duration format. Defaults to PT1M. Special case for 'FULL' value that returns single datapoint for entire time span requested.
*Examples: PT15M, PT1H, P1D, FULL*
fields.name: Interval

fields.description: The names of the metrics (comma separated) to retrieve.
fields.name: MetricNames

fields.description: Metric namespace where the metrics you want reside.
fields.name: MetricNamespace

fields.description:
The aggregation to use for sorting results and the direction of the sort.
Only one order can be specified.
Examples: sum asc.
fields.name: OrderBy

fields.description: Reduces the set of data collected. The syntax allowed depends on the operation. See the operation's description for details.
fields.name: ResultType

fields.description: Dimension name(s) to rollup results by. For example if you only want to see metric values with a filter like 'City eq Seattle or City eq Tacoma' but don't want to see separate values for each city, you can specify 'RollUpBy=City' to see the results for Seattle and Tacoma rolled up into one timeseries.
fields.name: RollUpBy

fields.description: The timespan of the query. It is a string with the following format 'startDateTime_ISO/endDateTime_ISO'.
fields.name: Timespan

fields.description:
The maximum number of records to retrieve.
Valid only if $filter is specified.
Defaults to 10.
fields.name: Top

fields.description: When set to false, invalid filter parameter values will be ignored. When set to true, an error is returned for invalid filter parameters. Defaults to true.
fields.name: ValidateDimensions
